review: Solid performer. Easy to install and integrate with existing A/V setup, home networking was a breeze.Biggest problem: Lack of 3rd party apps. Unlike the Roku, there aren't very many "channels" or apps that you can add to customize the experience. The built-in apps are good but not great (Internet Radio app is terrible).
author: A. Customer

review: The Apple TV is a very useful device.  If you have other Apple products, make purchases from the iTunes store, etc it brings all of that to your TV and stereo setup in a simple manner.  It automatically gives us access to our iTunes purchased content, we use AirPlay to stream music from our Synology diskstation, use our TV to show photos and videos we've taken on our phone, etc.  It brings everything together nicely.The big issue I've had is that updates frequently break it.  A recent update has caused network issues.  Each day I have to reboot the device to get network connectivity and AirPlay to work.  It's like every night it forgets how to network.  I tried fixing this by reseting the system to factory settings, but that only made it happen less frequently.  Also, all of the content you purchased in iTunes must be verified with an online server before it will play.  I've been unable to access my purchased content on two different occasions because of the server going down.  Perhaps I just happened to find the two outages in the past year, or (more likely) this happens rather frequently.Overall, I recommend getting it if you have a lot of iDevices and iContent.  Let's hope Apple gets its act together and stops pushing poor quality software, though.
